de.esoco.process.ui.composite

Class UiTableList<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.process.param.ParameterWrapper<T,C>
        • de.esoco.process.ui.UiComponent<java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>>,C>
          • de.esoco.process.ui.UiContainer<C>
            • de.esoco.process.ui.UiComposite<UiTableList<T>>
              • de.esoco.process.ui.composite.UiTableList<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.property.HasSelection<UiTableList.Row>, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UiPagingTableList

    public class UiTableList<T>
extends UiComposite<UiTableList<T>>
implements de.esoco.lib.property.HasSelection<UiTableList.Row>
    A table-like rendering of components in a list. The header and data areas are rendered with UiListPanel instances where the list items represent the header and data rows. The table appearance is achieved by using the same column grid layout for the item content.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      The component that describes a table column.

      The available styles for expandable tables: UiTableList.ExpandableTableStyle.EXPAND: expands a row inside the table.
      class  UiTableList.Row
      The component that contains the contents of a table row.

      • UiTableList

        public UiTableList(UiContainer<?> rParent)
        Creates a new instance with rows that can be expanded by selecting their header area. Expanding an item will reveal the item content and hide any other previously expanded item content.
        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        eExpandStyle - The expand style

      • addEmptyTableInfo

        public void addEmptyTableInfo(java.util.function.Consumer<UiBuilder<?>> fCreateEmtpyTableInfo)
        Adds components that will be displayed if a table is empty, i.e. it has now visible data rows. The argument is a function that receives an UI builder that must be used to build the empty table info component. This component will then be displayed below the table header.

        The application should not make assumptions about the layout of the builder's container and only add a single component. If it needs a more complex UI it should add a container with the required layout.

        Parameters:
        fCreateEmtpyTableInfo - A consumer that receives a builder for the empty table info area

      • addExpandedHeader

        public UiContainer<?> addExpandedHeader(UiLayout rLayout)
        Creates and returns a container that allows to add expanded content to the header of this list. The content will be displayed if the header is expanded by clicking on it. This method must be invoked before the list is rendered for the first time because it needs to modify the styles of the header components to support expansion.
        Parameters:
        rLayout - The layout of the expanded header content panel the builder is created for
        Returns:
        TODO: The container for the expanded header content

      • setData

        public void setData(de.esoco.lib.model.DataProvider<T> rRowDataProvider)
        Sets the data provider of the table row data. This will immediately build the table rows from the data so all necessary initializations of this table should have been performed already (e.g. settings columns or an expanded row builder).
        Parameters:
        rRowDataProvider - The data provider that returns the table rows

      • setExpandedRowBuilder

        public void setExpandedRowBuilder(java.util.function.BiConsumer<UiBuilder<?>,T> fBuilder)
        Sets a consumer that will be invoked to build the content of expanded rows if this table has an expansion style. This can be used for rows with simple row content where the full content can be build at once. For complex cases where the expanded row content should be updated only upon row selection a UiTableList.Row subclass should be used instead with overridden methods UiTableList.Row.initExpandedContent(UiBuilder) and UiTableList.Row.updateExpandedContent().

        The argument is a binary consumer that will be invoked with the builder for the row content container and the data object of the row.

        Parameters:
        fBuilder - The builder for the row content

      • setSelection

        public void setSelection(UiTableList.Row rRow)
        Sets the selection to a certain row.
        Specified by:
        setSelection in interface de.esoco.lib.property.HasSelection<UiTableList.Row>
        Parameters:
        rRow - The row to select or NULL for no selection

      • build

        protected void build()
        Can be overridden by subclasses to build the contents of this container. Alternatively the contents can also be built by adding components to it after creation. If both methods are used in combination the call to UiContainer.build() will occur afterwards because it is invoked just before the container is made visible (from UiContainer.applyProperties().

        The default implementation of this method does nothing.

        Overrides:
        build in class UiContainer<UiTableList<T>>

      • createColumn

        protected <V> UiTableList.Column<V> createColumn(java.util.function.Function<? super T,V> fGetColumnData)
        Creates a new column. Subclasses can override this method to return their own column subclasses, e.g. to handle special formatting or value parsing.
        Parameters:
        fGetColumnData - The column data access function
        Returns:
        The new column instance

      • createRow

        protected UiTableList.Row createRow(UiListPanel.Item rItem,
                                    T rRowData)
        Creates a new row. Subclasses can override this method to return their own row subclasses, e.g. to handle the row content.
        Parameters:
        rItem - The row item
        rRowData - The row data
        Returns:
        A new row instance

      • displayRows

        protected void displayRows(int nFirstRow,
                           int nCount)
        Update the rows of this table. This will also adjust the number of table rows (i.e. add or remove rows) to match the size of the given data set.
        Parameters:
        nFirstRow - The index of the first row to display
        nCount - The number of rows to display

      • update

        protected void update()
        Updates the table display from the data provider that has been set through setData(DataProvider). The default implementation renders all data objects from the provider. Subclasses can override this method if they need to display only part of the data, e.g. for a paging table.
